metadata.title: USN-7041-3 -- CUPS vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-7041-1 fixed a vulnerability in CUPS. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 16.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   Simone Margaritelli discovered that CUPS incorrectly sanitized IPP  data when creating PPD files. A remote attacker could possibly use this  issue to manipulate PPD files and execute arbitrary code when a printer is  used.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7041-3` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  cups - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 cups-bsd - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 cups-client - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 cups-common - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 cups-core-drivers - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 cups-daemon - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 cups-ipp-utils - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 cups-ppdc - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 cups-server-common - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 libcups2 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 libcups2-dev - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 libcupscgi1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 libcupscgi1-dev - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 libcupsimage2 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 libcupsimage2-dev - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 libcupsmime1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 libcupsmime1-dev - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 libcupsppdc1 - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 libcupsppdc1-dev - 2.1.3-4ubuntu0.11+esm8 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
